intro: Nuttallia lobata, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lobed leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at higher elevations. It has a hairy stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nuttallia lobata is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks.
